newsitem.title: FINLAND: Partek in insulation deal with U.S. firm.
newsitem.headline: Partek in insulation deal with U.S. firm.

text.p: Finnish construction materials and cargo equipment group Partek Oy Ab said Monday it will sell 60 percent of its Insulation unit's acoustics and interior design business to Armstrong World Industries Inc.

"Partek Insulation will sell 60 percent of its acoustics and interior design business to ... Armstrong ... and become a 40 percent shareholder of the new company which has been established to coordinate the suspended ceilings operations on the Nordic markets," Partek said in a statement.
"The transaction will have a slightly positive effect on Partek's result for this year," it said.
Financial details of the deal were not given.
Lancaster, Pennsylvania-based Armstrong is the world's largest producer of suspended ceiling systems, Partek said, adding the partners' product ranges complemented each other.
"Through this new company, Partek Insulation's acoustics and interior design products will join a large international firm and the market leader in Europe," it said.
